captions.text: You might have seen this symbol before,
whether it's as a temporary tattoo
or at a Chinese temple.
It's called the yin-yang symbol.
It comes from Taoism,
a religion born in China
and it has far more meaning than you probably realize.
The yin is the dark swirl,
and the yang is the light one,
and each side has a dot of the opposite color,
which gives a clue to the meaning of yin and yang.
Everything contains the seed of its opposite.
Darth Vadar has the seed of goodness,
and Luke has the potential to follow
his father to the dark side.
Like Luke and his father,
yin and yang are not total opposites,
they are relative to each other.
Taoists believe that the universe is made up
of energies, vibrations, and matter,
which behave differently
in different contexts.
Something can be yin or yang
depending on,
well, depending on lots of things.
So, while wheat that's growing is yang,
when it's being reaped, it's yin.
A wave's crest is yang,
and the trough is yin.
Villages on the sunny side of a valley in China
have names like Liuyang or Shiyang,
but on the shady side, for example,
of the Yangtze River Valley,
there's Jiangyin.
The brake is yin to the gas pedal's yang.
An eggshell is yang,
the egg inside is yin.
You think you're getting it?
Yang is harder,
stronger,
brighter,
and faster,
but one can turn into the other
or are two sides of the same coin.
The sunbeams are yang
in comparison to the shadows.
The pitch is yang,
the catch is yin.
The yang starts an action,
and the yin receives it,
completes it.
Yin is the inside space of a cup;
it wouldn't be a cup without it.
Yang is the cup.
The coffee's heat, however, is yang,
and its blackness is yin.
Yang goes berserk sometimes,
but there's some very powerful yins, too,
if they don't quite go berserk.
Yin is the darker swirl, the female,
but there is a white dot in it.
And yang is the lighter, the male,
but it has a black dot.
Water flowing calmly in a river is yin,
but when it goes over the waterfall,
it's very yang.
Toothpicks are yin
compared with a telephone pole.
The back of a person is more yin
than the front.
The top of a person is the yang end.
Taoism teaches that there is a power in the universe.
It's higher, deeper, and truer than any other force.
They call it the Tao.
It means the way.
Like the Force in Star Wars,
the Tao has two sides.
Unlike other religions where the higher power is all good,
and perhaps has an all-evil rival,
Taoism teaches that we need to learn
from both yin and yang.
And unlike religions with gods that are personal,
the higher power in Taoism is not.
Taoists believe that living in harmony with the way,
a person will not have to fight
against the universe's natural flow.
So, for example, listen more,
argue less.
Be ready to back up or undo something,
and you will make even faster progress.
Don't worry about being the best,
be who you are.
Live simply.
Complications take you away from the Tao.
"The wise person is flexible," Taoists say.
Learning to use the Tao
is what Taoism is all about,
and that's why you should know
your yin from your yang.

comments.text:
As a student of acupuncture and Chinese medicine, I learn that the front of 
the body is the yin side and the back of the side the yang side. Basically, 
the places where you are more likely to be tanner are Yang, like the 
outside of your forearms and legs, and the top of your body verses the 
bottom side. There is one Yang meridian that crosses the front of the body, 
the Stomach meridian, but overall, I have to disagree that the front of the 
body is the Yang side!﻿

comments.text:
Alan Watts had a good definition for the Tao: That which is so of itself. 
We Westerners are used to the idea of a commander/commandee relationship to 
the world, i.e. God and Man, but the Tao is completely different in the 
sense that Nature in and of itself is self-regulating and doesn't need a 
commander to tell it to go. All life, including us, grow out of it, in the 
same way that an apple tree "apples," (as a verb) our world "peoples."﻿

comments.author: life light

comments.text:
+Flaxify Antimatter can only exist together with matter, because it is it's 
direct opposite. Though not evenly spread, the ratio matter:antimatter in 
the universe should be 1:1. Einstein's equation E=m*c^2 comes in here. 
Energy equals mass (matter) times the speed of light squared. This means 
that, whilst creating matter, it will also create an equal and opposite 
amount of antimatter. When the matter and antimatter converge again, they 
eliminate each other, turning around the equation and creating energy. Seem 
from this perspective, Yin and Yang are very similar to matter and 
antimatter. They are opposites, yet they cannot exist separate from each 
other.

as i know, yin yang has it source from South of China and Vietnam, the 
foundation of yin yang is come from the farmers, they care about growing 
crop and develope life, so they have to observe nature, and they realise 
that everything in nature is balance, then the basic meaning of yin yang is 
found, to growing crop, there're 2 things: earth - sky, to develope life, 2 
things are father - mother, these things affect to the growth of plant and 
developement of human, that's the first concept, then when the Chinese go 
South, they have acquired the concept and developed it to a higher concept 
that we know nowaday
so there are some basic meaning of yin yang
- yin means cold, yang means hot
- the North is yin (because China is a cold country), the South is yang 
(Vietnam is a tropical country)
- then it relate to weather, Spring, Summer is yang, Autumn, Winter is yin
- then relate to time, nights (temperature is low) are yin, days (have 
sunlight, temperature is high) are yang
- nights are dark, so yin is black, days are bright, so yang is white
- number like 1 3 5 7 9... is yang, other like 2 4 6 8 10... is yin
- male are yang (because male can't give birth, they only have 1 life), 
female are yin (female can give birth, 2 life in a body)
- square are yin, sphere are yang, it relate to mathematics which is hard 
for me to explain
- yin are negative, yang are positive, sometime you understand it as good 
and bad
- yin mean dead, yang mean birth
and a lot more, just read it in Vietnam Wikipedia
beside, there're nothing is absolute good or absolute bad, in yang has yin 
and in yin has yang, mean that in good has bad, in bad has good, that's the 
black dot and white dot mean
for example, you drink coffee, it delicious, tasty... but drink it too much 
will cause you unable to sleep, or when you sick, just take a pill, it will 
cure your sick but it always has side effect, still not good
another meaning is about the nature balance
- in science, there are matter - anti matter, electron+ - electron-, acid - 
base.....
- in nature, there're fire - water, sunny - rainy, earth - sky.....
See ? everything in nature is in balance, that the meaning of yin yang
In Asia, especially in Vietnam, where i live, i find that yin yang are used 
in every corner of life, in medicine, food, feng shui, people, building...﻿

comments.author: BDevS Section -B

comments.text:
The basics of Yin Yang. 

Yin Yang is a complex concept that has undergone changes from its ancient 
beginnings with Taoism/Daoism religion. However, Yin Yang is a Chinese and 
Taoist philosophy (not religion) based on observations of nature. 
'Everything in nature is whole, a balance of Yin Yang energies.

The concept of this duality manifested itself into the origins of Chinese 
science, philosophy, traditional medicine, and martial arts. Later, 
Confucianism and the I Ching Ten Wings gave the concept a greater moral 
aspect. The Han Dynasty was very influential in the metamorphosis from the 
old ways to the new. In fact, many compare the age of the Han Dynasty to 
the Ancient Greek enlightenment.

On the other hand, before I delve further I would like to present a video 
that gives a 'basic' idea of Yin Yang. My start to fulfill an agreement. +Yoongyee 
Poh :-))) ﻿

comments.text:
+Małgorzata B-M Actually not everything has been written. Many of the old 
writings have used, what we now refer to as, ambiguous terms to try and 
explain questions. This has created scholarly debates over millennium.

However, there is an essence that seems to reveal a small truth that is 
constantly being reinterpreted. In the case of Yin Yang; reinterpretations 
are finding their way into science to assist in understanding and/or 
explaining problems.

comments.text:
Yes I agree that it is not truly accurate. It is a bit misleading with the 
Confucius, I Ching remark. Yin Yang is actually a part of the ancient I 
Ching (Book of Changes), but  I was referring to the later association of 
the I Ching, the Ten Wings and Confucius. Oops. Odd thing is that when I 
was writing that part I had a feeling it was not stated right. :-)

comments.author: Flaxify

comments.text:
+Flaxify I see.. that was indeed a fluid animation.
I do believe only God is good. Every other thing that seem to have an 
opposite form is probably just 'cause' and 'effect'. Good builds, Evil 
destroys. I think Good is cause, while evil is effect. Good wins by 
building up, evil wins by bringing down. Good can never destroy, evil can 
never rise.

Of course, opposite forms of things exist but that does not explicitly 
explain all things in the universe. I kinda prefer Newton's 3rd Law of 
motion better; "For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction" 
OR "all forces exist in pairs."
The mind exist because of the soul, and each soul is unique since the very 
beginning of its existence. I believe there is no opposite of you.

And hey, you have a nice way to look at things :)
